name: Programming on the way of GitHub
tagline: GitHub Pages show what I am thinking and doing
body:
# Motivation
The programming world is being changed everyday. A programmer has to learn the new skills or technology continuously to adjust himself for various of requirements in his career. One way to gain the experiences is from working and another way is in practice at school or home.

Each software company provides the same programming environment for its developers - programming language, framework, IDE, database, issue (or project) tracking system and version control system. The skills are almost inflexible. Many projects use Subversion as version control system and Jira (or Bugzilla) as issue (or project) tracking system. My company is no exception.

I had built a private programming environment home. I had installed Subversion on Debian and Later changed to GitLab on CentOS. I had to be not only as a programmer but also as an administrator. Switching between both roles made me tired and could not focus on programming.

Thanks to GitHub. It realizes not only all features of Git, but also bug tracking features on its web. I can focus on writing my projects anywhere and all the of them will be managed by GitHub.

# Projects
Some of projects are running or waiting to start.

## Sudoku
Design and implement a Sudoku algorithm with Java Swing. Learn new features of Java SE 7 and 8. Use Factory Method Pattern to compare the performance between Java SE 6, 7 and 8.

## JSudoku
Design and implement web-based Sudoku application with Java EE 7.

## PSudoku
Design and implement web-based Sudoku application with Python and Django.

## RSudoku
Design and implement web-based Sudoku application with Ruby on Rails.

## ticket-monster
Refer to [Ticket Monster tutorial](http://www.jboss.org/ticket-monster/) step by step learn features of Java EE 6 with jboss-eap-6.3 or WildFly 8.x copyright by JBoss Developer (@jboss-developer) on GitHub.

## Oozinoz
Learn Design patterns. View source code in [Design Patterns In Java by Steve Metsker and William Wake](http://xp123.com/oozinoz/designpatternsinjava.htm)

## kap_04-07_low_level
Java EE 7 application low level with WildFly 8.x

## kap_08-09_high_level
Java EE 7 application high level with WildFly 8.x
